reviewText: Released as a home video concert on VHS away back in 1984, it was the last project Tosh was involved with other than "No More Nuclear War". This DVD sadly is just a VHS transfer, they could have really stepped up in 2002 and remastered the concert, added in a 5.1 mix and bonus songs, but still, as is, it is still a great concert DVD. Peter Tosh delivers a great show as always and includes many songs from his excellent album "Mama Africa" as that was the current tour. It's a must own for a great reggae concert and to see the mighty Peter Tosh live. I just wish more concert DVD's get released by Tosh!

reviewText: Man was I in awe when I finished watching this concert !! Like other reviewers stated, this is obviously not the complete gig (and Legalize It, everyone's absolute fav, was sadly left out; censorship ??!!! ). The concert starts outs with the smoother, slower songs and keeps picking up the pace like crazy till the very end, with the rockier, twin axe attack making the sound to smoulder. The lead guitarrist is clearly a Hendrix fan !! Peter is seen smoking no less than 4 rolled up ones :-) and mid-concert he sits down to play the most epic bongo part on a reggae song EVER. The guy plays keeping unreal, metronomic tempo while stoned outta his brains !! The concert is edited to clock in at a meagre 57', but the power is so high I could not have taken another song; I was floored !!!The filming, while shot with just 5 cameras, which seem like there were many more because it's so dynamic and creative it's simply perfect. EVERY highlighted sound has its visual counterpart, be either fretboards or drums; damn me if the guy who edited this was not a drummer !!! Up to 3 different angles are used on the cans, esp during punctuation beats. I could although have had more takes on the bass player, who is largely ignored for some reason. A surprising flaw is that the lead and the rhythm axes are inverted in the mix; not a deal-breaker but each guy is standing on either side of the stage and their sounds come from the opposite speaker.Pic : maybe the worst part; it looks like a direct transfer from a low-gen VHS tape, and a pretty beaten up one at that, not the original master. The pic bitrate on the other hand, has been optimized and goes from 7 to 9.5 Mbps, very nice. Menu is a very simple affair but I don't care about them, so...Sound : my fav soundstream, LPCM is used. I love that, it's loud, lossless audio, no fake 5.1 bull or silly DTS (sorry HT lovers !). The good : the mix is very clear an detailed; every instrument is clearly audible and perfectly located in the stereo landscape. Vox is high but just as to convey the the lyrics clearly, not interfering with the music at all. The not-so-good : bottom end is very thin. I had to crank my sub quite a lot and that did help, but basically there's little under 40 Hz there so the pulse of the music is a tad compromised, but the overall sound achieved more than makes it up for that problem; cymbals are sweet !!!Conclusion : love PT ? Gotta own this. Avert your eyes in respect before the master !! (but you can stare at him on DVD now !!)
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw Peter Tosh in this tour while I was studying in New Orleans (Sept. 1983), I am not sure if it was just before or after this show was taped. Well, unfortunatly we can not see him anymore, but this DVD captures the escence of this great show. Great performance by PT and the band, specially Santa Davis (drums) and Fully Fulwood (bass). If you like reggae or if you like to see a good show, just go ahead an get this DVD, you will not regret it. A gret show from one of reggea prime musician. I only gave it four stars because the DVD has only part of the performance, for full concert please check the double CD Captured Live.
